title: Publications
text:
Manuscripts & Works in Progress
My research focuses on statistical genomics and Bayesian methodology. Below is a summary of my current manuscripts.
Full texts, supplementary data, and reproducibility code will be made available here upon final publication.


1. A Novel Cell-free DNA Analysis Framework (cf-TREBLE)

Status: Under review at Nature Communications.



2. Cell-free DNA Methylation Analysis for Endometriosis

Status: Accepted with minor revision at Molecular Human Reproduction (Molehr).

title: Yucheng Wang
text:
I am a Ph.D. Candidate in Statistics at the University of Pittsburgh, honored to be an Andrew W. Mellon Predoctoral Fellow (2025-2026).
My research focuses on developing statistically rigorous and computationally efficient frameworks for high-dimensional genomic data. I am particularly interested in Bayesian methodology and its application to cell-free DNA (cfDNA) for non-invasive disease diagnostics.
Prior to my Ph.D., I obtained my M.S. in Statistical Practice from Carnegie Mellon University and my B.S. in Statistics from SUSTech.

title: Yucheng Wang
text:
I am a Ph.D. Candidate in Statistics at the University of Pittsburgh, honored to be an Andrew W. Mellon Predoctoral Fellow (2025-2026).
My research focuses on developing statistically rigorous and computationally efficient frameworks for high-dimensional genomic data. I am particularly interested in Bayesian methodology and its application to cell-free DNA (cfDNA) for non-invasive disease diagnostics.

title: Yucheng Wang
text:
Research Interests
My research interests include Bayesian Statistics, Machine Learning, and Statistical Genomics.
I have specialized expertise in High-Performance Computing (HPC), Parallel Computing, and Rcpp implementation, aiming to develop scalable tools for large-scale biomedical data

title: Yucheng Wang
text:
Selected Experience

Bioinformatics Software Engineer Intern | SignatureDx (2025)

Developed ML-driven cfDNA deconvolution frameworks for monitoring organ-transplant rejection.

Algorithm Engineer Intern | JD.com (2020)

Built large-scale recommendation pipelines using PySpark and LightGBM for millions of users.

title: Can quantum-mechanical description of physical reality be considered complete?
text:
Abstract
In a complete theory there is an element corresponding to each element of reality. A sufficient condition for the reality of a physical quantity is the possibility of predicting it with certainty, without disturbing the system. In quantum mechanics in the case of two physical quantities described by non-commuting operators, the knowledge of one precludes the knowledge of the other. Then either (1) the description of reality given by the wave function in quantum mechanics is not complete or (2) these two quantities cannot have simultaneous reality. Consideration of the problem of making predictions concerning a system on the basis of measurements made on another system that had previously interacted with it leads to the result that if (1) is false then (2) is also false. One is thus led to conclude that the description of reality as given by a wave function is not complete.

title: Can quantum-mechanical description of physical reality be considered complete?

cf-TREBLE: A Novel Cell-free DNA Analysis Framework


Yucheng Wang


Under review at Nature Communications


Proposed a rigorous Bayesian statistical framework for large-scale methylation-data analysis. Developed a novel tree-based hierarchical model and reimplemented core methods in C++ for 70% runtime improvement.


Nov 2023


Aug 2025






 


Fragment-based Deconvolution Algorithm


Yucheng Wang


Methodological Research


Developed a likelihood-based fragment-level cfDNA deconvolution method capturing CpG correlations via a spatial probit model with a Matérn kernel. Implemented efficient Gibbs sampling for HPC clusters.


Mar 2024


Present






 


Automated Weather Forecasting Pipeline


Yucheng Wang


Collaborative Project with Allegheny County Health Dept


Built an automated ETL pipeline for continuous weather-data acquisition. Developed predictive models using XGBoost and ARIMA, achieving high agreement with official forecasts.


Feb 2022


May 2022






 


Cell-free DNA Methylation Analysis for Endometriosis


Yucheng Wang


Clinical Data Analysis (Minor Revision)


Analyzed cfDNA methylation profiles from 637 endometriosis cases. Identified key immune and endothelial cell variation factors (Factor 11) and potential biomarkers for minimally invasive diagnosis.


Aug 2023


Dec 2024






 


Admixture and Survival Analysis of Heart Failure


Yucheng Wang


Collaborative Project with Pitt School of Medicine


Estimated African ancestry proportions in 505 patients via admixture modeling. Conducted GWAS to identify genetic markers linked to treatment efficacy and mortality risk.


Aug 2023


Jan 2024

title: Teaching & Academic Service
text:
Misc / Fun Facts





Amateur Powerlifter
“Super amateur, but passionate.”
Outside of statistics, I am a dedicated powerlifting enthusiast. I enjoy the discipline of the “Big Three” (Squat, Bench, Deadlift) and applying the same consistency in the gym as I do in research.
